title: Heimer in all-for-one!?!?
body: Well, what could be worse than a donger with three turrets? How about 5 with 15, camping your lane? What could be more fun than to come down lane and see enemy tower getting defended with Donger {{champion:74}}  turrets and winions? I much rather have 10 Satans (I mean uh.. Teemos {{champion:17}} ) running around blinding each other while they lay their poison shits (erm... shrooms) and leading enemy midgets into them. I mean, am I right? What champs do you think are horrible to go against eachother?{{champion:238}} ? {{champion:91}} ?{{champion:11}} ? {{champion:7}} ?

replies.body:
{{champion:14}} is actually ban worthy in OFA. 
He doesn't have that much kill potential early but it's really hard to get kills on them (5 Sions) early as well because of their zoning and CC potential with Q and E. 
Once they have a couple of ranks on W you will not be dealing damage if you're a squishy carry, you simply won't kill enough of them. If you are a squishy carry type then they will cut right through you with their decent base damage with Q and W and later their ult. 

You will be forced to Flash out of two Sion's charging their Qs after they slow you with their Es just so that you don't get CCed and die from their high W dmg throughout the whole game. 

After they get a Black Cleaver they can all literally ult towards your towers and autoatatck them, because they are so tanky with items like Randuin's, Banshee's Veil and what not they will take ages to kill by 20 minutes. Imagine trying to kill 5 super tanky Sions at 20 min mark when your tower can barely kill one. 
If you do manage to kill them their passives will happen and they will take down the tower, they can keep doing that every time and you can't stop them. 

He can do this against any champion in the game. 

Seriously, try Sion with a couple of mates, it's OP as fuck!

Squishy carry? Those get countered by pretty much everyone. You need a solid game-plan for an adc in an obviously non-meta team (i.e. 5 Caitlyns), and in OfA matchmaking, that will never happen.

My suggestion against tanks? Screw standard builds. All 5 of you should get the following in the following order:

* 5 borks
* 5 runaan's
* 3 lw, 2 cleaver
* 3 cleaver, 2 lw
* 5 bt's
* 5 phantom dancers

Now the question is, will you ever get far enough along this team buildpath before you're all totally crushed? Who knows...

Not just ADCs.
{{champion:134}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:69}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:99}} etc
All traditionally squishy characters can't do anything against 5 Sions past 20 min mark because the Sions have items that let them tank damage for a long long time. 

5 Sions can literally ult up to your towers and take them down with or without their passives. Trying to kill them is counter productive but not killing them allows them to keep AAing the tower down. 

Thinking about it right now, I think {{champion:40}} would be a good counter because of her ultimate and knock-up but Sion can just run through it with his ult so Idk, she's squishy as well.
Okay, maybe, I don't see sions often enough to know, but as long as we're not generalizing to fighters. Mages can crap all over fighters.

Try it dude. No joke, the most fun I've ever had in OFA - if your team trusts each other enough to all focus one tower, you will get the tower no matter what, and you can ult out if you need a quick escape, it's so strong, I can't think of any hard counters to the strategy.

Just had a Sion vs. Lux game. Yeah, she got destroyed.

Still, CANNOT generalize to fighters. But yes, 5 Sion's - with a) their naturally superior health b) their ults of infinite tenacity and c) their post-death champ deletions - are, I can imagine, a pretty hard counter to every common strategy in OfA.

I'm wondering about Heimer though. I predict the donger gets wrecked too.
Yep.

True, but its kinda BS if you think about it. I mean, yeah he's a fun champ, but atleast play someone with a "little" more skill

That's why I'm starting to hate All for one it's the same dumb champions {{champion:53}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:74}} {{champion:203}} {{champion:45}} {{champion:99}}   Every time I can somehow win a vote with a different champion someone dodges and I go back to the same champions again.
Right?!?!

The whole "skill" argument is nonsense, and way too overused, and telling people what they SHOULDN'T play is a bad idea, but I do agree on the overarching point: 30-40% of the playerbase shouldn't be forced to play what the other 60% insists on spamming monotonously to no end.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/summoners-rift/JjtHMrZb-50-of-all-picks-in-ofa-belong-to-6-champs

I'm not asking players to change their picks. I just want Rito to match people based on preference so everything I play isn't dependent on what a bunch of people who just voted heimer 10 games in a row pick.

havent played much but id think {{champion:32}} {{champion:41}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:113}} {{champion:26}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:161}} {{champion:69}} **{{champion:67}} {{champion:28}} **

{{champion:35}} : He's unstoppable. Way too many jukes. I still want to see a shaco game with, by midgame, 3 splitpushing lifesteal ad shaco's and 2 ap roamer-counterjunglers. That would be so obnoxious.

{{champion:76}} : Had an awesome game against darius as nid. Unfortunately, all 4 of my allies went ap, so no shred against a heavy-health champ except me. I went devourer's, bork, runaan's, hydra (yes, that's right, runaan's hydra, nid ult too gud) and then bt and randuin's I think. I had the highest damage output by far:

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1985996116/43297115?tab=stats

Really, when you're a squish against a fighter (or if you're a squish, period) you really need a sustain shredder on your team. I did bork/runaan's on sona too, and about the time my teammates were getting counterred by kat midgame builds, I started to carry. It's also awesome on mages when you can combine it with wit's/abyssal to <3 your teammates.

{{champion:113}} : I pwned Tahm as her, but got the standard "WHO PICKED SEJ?!" rage BS from someone the moment they died more than once, which seems to happen every time there's a champ that isn't picked a billion times. Ugh. We won btw. And very easily.

{{champion:67}} : If you can get your team to focus one target, the silverbullets are insane. Instatank death in about 2 seconds.

{{champion:84}} : Was 2v1 vs 2 yasuos top, went 25/2/5. 'Nough said.

{{champion:32}} : Faced him as Veigar. That was hilarious. He eventually won, but it was still worth.

{{champion:28}} : Played her against Rengar. Another hilarious matchup. Ren sucks to fight early, but by endgame, our shred was unstoppable. We won.

{{champion:41}} : He turns out to not be as OP as you'd think. I think since the barrel nerf, he doesn't pose much of a threat. He's also VERY lategame in a group of all GPs. He also can't counterbuild really. He has a very specific critbuild he needs to be useful eventually in fights. I bet you though, a pre-made of GPs could rock. So far, the standard plan is for people to stack GP ults, but once the enemy is out of it, who cares? Probably what would work better is a coordinated set of simultaneous but SPREAD OUT ults in one lane, so there's nowhere to go. But again, you'd need a premade.

All this to say: None of these champs are easy to get, but they're all really fun to play. It still boggles my mind that majority picks are so loppsided towards 10 champs that LITERALLY make up 70% of all picks.
